trans-unit.source: Provides paging functionality for data-bound controls that implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer"></xref> interface, such as the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Pager Fields](#pager_fields)
[Page Properties](#page_properties)
[Accessibility](#Accessibility)
[Declarative Syntax](#DeclarativeSyntax)
Introduction

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> class is used to page data and to display navigation controls for data-bound controls that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface.
(An example of a control that implements the interface is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.)
You can associate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control with the data-bound control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property.
Alternatively, you can put the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control inside the data-bound control hierarchy.

For example, in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, you can put the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template.
You can customize the number of items that are displayed for each page of data by changing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A> property.
You can also change the way a page is submitted to the server by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property.
Pager Fields
In order for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to display navigation controls, you must add pager fields to the control.
The pager fields derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.
The following table lists the pager field types that you can use.
Pager field type
Description
Enables users to navigate through pages one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page.
Enables users to select a page by page number.
Enables you to create a custom paging UI.
To declaratively add pager fields to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control, add a `Fields` element to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
You can then add the pager fields to the `Fields` element.
The pager fields are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection in the order that they appear in the `Fields` element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection enables you to programmatically manage the pager fields in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Page Properties
The following table lists read-only properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control that specify characteristics of the page of data.
These properties are usually used for binding expressions in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object.
Property
Description
The maximum number of records that are displayed for each page of data.
The index of the first record that is displayed on a page of data.
The total number of records that are available in the underlying data source.
Accessibility
The default markup that is rendered default for this control might not comply with accessibility standards, such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines.
For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> class.
To dynamically add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to a page, create a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> object.
Set its properties, and then add it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of a container control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PlaceHolder> control.
Adds HTML attributes and styles to be rendered in the browser to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method is primarily used by control developers to insert additional attributes and styles in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> output stream for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
An object that represents the output stream to render HTML content to the browser.
Gets a collection of custom attribute name/value pairs for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Attributes%2A> collection to manage the attribute name/value pairs that are declared in the opening tag of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control, but that are not directly supported by the class.
You can programmatically add or remove attributes to the collection.
A collection of custom attribute name/value pairs.
Connects events to event handler methods in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.ConnectToEvents%2A> method specifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnTotalRowCountAvailable%2A> method as the handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer.TotalRowCountAvailable?displayProperty=fullName> event of the control specified in `container`.

The `container` parameter must contain a data-bound control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The data-bound control that raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer.TotalRowCountAvailable"></xref> event.
container is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object that represents the child controls for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control in the UI hierarchy.
You can add controls to the collection, remove controls from the collection, or iterate through the server controls in the collection.
The collection of child controls for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

Creates the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> objects that are contained by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.CreatePagerFields%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A> property and by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnTotalRowCountAvailable%2A> method to create the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> objects that are contained by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> property.
This method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CreateDataPagers%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create the user interface (UI) controls for each field in the collection.

The pager fields are created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in the order that the pager fields appear in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection.

The following table shows the pager field classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class and that can be created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Pager field type
Description
Enables users to navigate through pages of data one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page of data.
Enables users to select a page of data by page number.
Enables you to create a custom paging UI.
Binds the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control and all its child controls to a data source.
This implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.DataBind> method overrides the base class implementation.
The overridden method verifies that all child controls have been created before binding them to a data source.

Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> objects that represent the pager fields that are specified in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The pager fields are displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in the order that the pager fields appear in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection.

The following table shows the pager field classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class and that can be used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection.
Pager field type
Description
Enables users to navigate through pages of data one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page of data.
Enables users to select a page of data by page number.
Enables you to create a custom paging UI.
To declaratively specify the pager fields for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control, put a `Fields` element inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
You can then list the pager fields you want to include between the opening and closing `<Fields>` tags.
You can programmatically add pager fields to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection.
However, it is easier to list the pager fields declaratively in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
A collection object that contains all the pager fields that are specified in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
Retrieves the data-bound control that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
The data-bound control retrieved by this method references a data source object that contains the data that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control pages.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to be able to page this data, the data-bound control must implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.FindPageableItemContainer%2A> method checks whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property is set to the ID of a data-bound control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.FindPageableItemContainer%2A> method goes up the stack of naming containers to look for a data-bound control.

For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control is inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property does not have to be set.

This is because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.FindPageableItemContainer%2A> method can automatically find the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control by examining the control tree.
The data-bound control that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
A control that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer"></xref> interface was not found on the page.
-or-

The control specified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID"></xref> property does not implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer"></xref> interface.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control does not have a naming container.

Loads the state information for the properties in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control that must be persisted between postbacks, even when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.EnableViewState"></xref> property is set to `false`.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
An object that represents the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
There is no data-bound control associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

Restores view-state information for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control that was saved by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.SaveViewState"></xref> method during a previous page request.
This method is primarily used by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
An object that represents the state to be restored.
Gets the maximum number of records that are displayed for each page of data.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.MaximumRows%2A> property to retrieve the size of a page of data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.MaximumRows%2A> property contains the same value as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A>property.
You can change the value of this property by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A> property.
The maximum number of records that are displayed for each page of data.
Determines whether an event for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control is passed up the page's user interface (UI) server control hierarchy
The source of the event.
The event data.
`true` if the event has been sent to the parent control; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
When notified by this method, Web server controls must perform any initialization steps that are required in order to create and set up an instance.
In this stage of the server control's life cycle, the control's view state has not yet been populated.
Additionally, you cannot access other server controls when this method is called, regardless of whether it is a child or parent to this control.
Other server controls are not guaranteed to be created and ready for access.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnInit%2A> method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Load"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnLoad%2A> method notifies the server control that it should perform actions that are common to each HTTP request for the page that it is associated with.
At this stage in the page life cycle, server controls in the hierarchy are created and initialized.
View state is restored, and form controls reflect values that were posted from the client.

This implementation also invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.FindPageableItemContainer%2A> method to find the container control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface, and it initializes the page properties.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnLoad%2A> method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The event data.
A container control that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer"></xref> interface was not found.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer.TotalRowCountAvailable"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer.TotalRowCountAvailable?displayProperty=fullName> event when the total number of records in its underlying data source is available.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnTotalRowCountAvailable%2A> method is a handler for this event and is responsible for updating the page-related properties and recreating the pager field objects.
The source of the event.
The event data.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ID"></xref> of the control that contains the data that will be paged by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property to specify the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> of the control that contains the data that will be paged by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

The specified control must implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface and must use the same naming container as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
An example of a control that you can specify is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

If this property is an empty string or `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control checks whether its container control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer> interface.

For example, in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A> property does not have to be set if you put the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template.
This is because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control can automatically find the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control by examining the control tree.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ID"></xref> of the control that contains the data that will be paged by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
The default is an empty string, which indicates that this property is not set.
Gets or sets the number of records that are displayed for each page of data.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A> property to specify the size of a page of data.

If you have multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> controls in a page that are bound to the same <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, be sure to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A> property of these controls to the same value.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> controls are set to use different page sizes, the last <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to be initialized determines the actual page size of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
The number of records that are displayed for each page of data.
The default is 10.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize"></xref> property is set to a value less than 1.
Gets or sets the name of the query string field.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property to specify that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control uses an HTTP GET command to navigate through the pages.
In GET requests, a query string field that consists of a name/value pair is added to the URL of the page.
The name is set by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property.
The value is the corresponding page number.
If <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> is an empty string or `null`, the control uses an HTTP POST command to navigate through the pages.
Setting this property is useful if you want to have all the pages of data indexed by a search engine.
This occurs because the control produces a different URL for each page of data.
When you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property, the following conditions might apply:
You have more than one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in a page and they reference the same data-bound control.
In that case, make sure that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property of these <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> controls is set to the same value.
You have more than one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in a page and they reference different data-bound controls.
In that case, make sure that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property of these <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> controls is set to different values.

If you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> controls to the same value, the associated data-bound controls will be paginated at the same time, because they will use the same query-string field.
If you do not follow the previous guidelines, unexpected paging behavior can occur.
However, no exception will be thrown by the control.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A> property is not an empty string or `null`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField.ButtonType%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> objects is ignored.
In that case, these objects use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control to create their navigation buttons.
The name of the query string field.
The default is an empty string, which indicates that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control will use a HTTP POST command to navigate through the pages.
Creates child controls of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.RecreateChildControls%2A> method is the implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23ICompositeControlDesignerAccessor%23RecreateChildControls%2A> interface method.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

Sends the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control content to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, which writes the content to be rendered to the browser.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Render%2A> method writes the content of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control and its child controls to the browser by using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The object that receives the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control content.
Renders the HTML opening tag of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control to the specified writer.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
An object that represents the output stream to render HTML content to the browser.
Renders the contents of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control to the specified writer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.RenderContents%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Render%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to render its contents.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
An object that represents the output stream to render HTML content to the browser.

Saves the state of the properties in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control that must be persisted between postbacks, even when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.EnableViewState"></xref> property is set to `false`.
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Returns the current view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.
Saves any changes to an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control's view-state that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically put in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save-state stage of the server control life cycle.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
When view state is saved, this string object is sent to the browser as a variable that is stored in a hidden element in the page.
When you create custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying the server control's `ViewState` property.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).
This method is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Returns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control's current view state.
If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.
Sets the page-related properties in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.SetPageProperties%2A> method sets new values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.MaximumRows%2A> properties.

It also invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IPageableItemContainer.SetPageProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to update the page-related properties in the associated data-bound control.
The index of the first record on the page of data.
The maximum number of items on a single page of data.
`true` to rebind the control after the properties are set; otherwise, `false`.
There is no data-bound control associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
Gets the index of the first record that is displayed on a page of data .
The index of the first record that is displayed on a page of data.
Gets the HTML element that is used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.TagKey%2A> property returns an HTML element that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.RenderBeginTag%2A> method to write the appropriate markup for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
This property overrides the base implementation to always return <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag?displayProperty=fullName>.
This property is primarily used by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
Always <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag.Span"></xref>.
Gets the total number of records that are retrieved by the underlying data source object that is referenced by the associated data-bound control.
The total number of records that are retrieved by the underlying data source object.
Tracks view-state changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control so that they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This object can be accessed through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.TrackViewState%2A> method is called automatically at the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control's life cycle.
This method alerts ASP.NET to monitor changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> server control's view state.
Retrieves the attribute value with the specified name from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The name of the attribute.
The value of the attribute.
Sets an attribute of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control with the specified name and value.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The name of the attribute to set.
The value of the attribute.
Creates the child controls of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23ICompositeControlDesignerAccessor%23RecreateChildControls%2A> method enables a designer for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to re-create the control's child controls at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.System%23Web%23UI%23WebControls%23ICompositeControlDesignerAccessor%23RecreateChildControls%2A> interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.RecreateChildControls%2A> method, which contains the actual implementation and which can be extended by control developers.
